description: Single storey side extension; single storey detached garden outbuilding for use as ancillary residential annexe.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: Site Location Plan, Site Block Plan, Drawing Titled Existing Floor Plans & Elevations Proposed Floor Plans & Elevations Revision A dated June 2020 and Design & Access Statement for 19 Cedar Grove produced by H S Associates.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or in the approved drawings and documents listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012).	 | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes ancillary to the dwelling on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
